sources.title: The Day the Earth Moved
sources.description: Title: The Day the Earth Moved Summary: A team taking aerial photographs of the desert deduces that an earthquake is about to strike a nearby town, but nobody in the town believes them. Directed by: Robert Michael Lewis Actors: Jackie Cooper, Stella Stevens, Cleavon Little Production Company: ABC Circle Films Release Date: TV Movie 18 September 1974 Aspect Ratio: 1.33 : 1 A pair of aerial photographers discover that, due to a flaw in the film they are using, they can predict when and where an earthquake is about to hit. When they discover that a quake is about to strike a small desert community, the two photographers race against time to save the inhabitants before it is too late.

metadata.Plot: A pair of aerial photographers discover that, due to a flaw in the film they are using, they can predict when and where an earthquake is about to hit. When they discover that a quake is about to strike a small desert community, the two photographers race against time to save the inhabitants before it is too late.
metadata.Actors: Jackie Cooper, Stella Stevens, Cleavon Little
